meanings.definition: A device that makes a buzzing sound.
meanings.sent1: The buzzer on the alarm clock woke me up.
meanings.sent2: The buzzer on the game show signaled the end of the round.
meanings.sent3: The buzzer on the doorbell buzzed loudly, surprising the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The buzzer in the classroom buzzed like a busy bee, reminding students of the time.
meanings.sent5: The buzzer in the quiz was so loud, it felt like it buzzed right next to my ear.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that buzzes.
meanings.sent1: The bee was a buzzer flying around the garden.
meanings.sent2: The mosquito was a buzzer annoying everyone at the picnic.
meanings.sent3: The little boy imitated a buzzer, pretending to fly around like a bee.
meanings.sent4: The phone was a buzzer in the quiet room, constantly vibrating with notifications.
meanings.sent5: The toy helicopter was a buzzer, making buzzing sounds as it flew around the room.

meanings.definition: A signaling device that produces a buzzing sound.
meanings.sent1: The buzzer at the game signaled the end of the match.
meanings.sent2: The buzzer on the oven let us know the cookies were ready.
meanings.sent3: The buzzer on the timer buzzed frantically, reminding us of the boiling water.
meanings.sent4: The buzzer on the intercom buzzed softly, indicating someone was at the door.
meanings.sent5: The buzzer on the microwave was a lifesaver, alerting us when the food was heated.
